result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J Watson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Concurrent with Revocation sentences in 14CF609 & 14CM1298 - Probation begins today
.

miscConds.notes:
Obtain and maintain at least part-time employment or pursue course of education
.

Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

No Contact with D.W.

The Court will consider a modification of the No Contact if def is doing well and free from probation violations - a letter can be written to this Court for a review of the No Contact if requested
.

Complete a Domestic Abuse assessment if PO feels a new one is needed and comply with any treatment recommended

Attend Domestic Court Reviews - first Hearing is on 6-23-15 at 4:00 pm in Br 5

Complete any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by the PO and follow-through with any treatment recommended

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

No sentence credit if probation is ever revoked

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: Concurrent with La Crosse Co cases 15CM329 & 15CM309
.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay Court financial obligations as originally ordered

Pay DOC Supervision fees

If extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

All parties have reviewed revocation paperwork filed
Notice of Right to seek Postconviction Relief filed

- Initial Term of Confinement is 12 mos - w/ credit for 187 days Concurrent w/ 15CM329 & 15CM309
- Extended Supervision is 3 mos - pay DOC Supervision fees;  Pay Court financial obligations as originally ordered

records.addlTxt:
for GLD
Def N/A
App req out for him

Rukmini Vasupuram appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court calls Christopher Watson 4:42pm now present by phone
Def not feeling well today.
Def - Waiting to get into groups, see my counselor about every 3 weeks.
Vasupuran - I think he is still pretty new on probation.
Court: Stay on track
Review Hearing: 09-01-15 at 4:00pm
Def asks about time out to go to YMCA, PO says Court or Doctor have to approve that
Vasupuram - The Agent is the one that has to approve that.  He is serving a sentence
on EM right now.
Court: This may be something that is up to your Agent to approve, talk to your Agent
if your Agent says No then you can send me a letter or something about this.
Def - I think my Agent approved it and put it in the review.
Vasupuram - It is pretty soon after getting things started, so not a practical
thing right now.
Review Hearing: 09-01-15 at 4:00pm

Def - Things going well
State comments
Review hearing: 07-28-15 at 4:00pm w/CCMT

State by Skemp /  Def in custody w/ Atty Allan Beatty
Beatty cites agreement
State has complied w/ victim notification
Plea Quest & Waiver filed
Ct 3 - Def pleads GUILTY
CRT finds def's plea is FV&I made - factual basis exists to accept def's plea & CRT finds def guilty
Remaining Cts are Dismissed & read-in
CRT'S SENTENCE:  Sent w/held;  Probation 2 yrs Concurrent w/ revocation sentences in 14CF609 & 14CM1298, w/ conditions: AODA & follow-thru w/ trmt recommended;  Undergo Domestic Abuse assessment if PO feels a new one is needed & follow-through w/ recommendations;  Attend Domestic CRT Reviews;  No Contact w/ D.W.;  Obtain & maintain at least part-time employment or undergo course of education;  Complete any other assessments or evaluations deemed approp by the PO & follow-thru w/ any trmt recommended;  Pay CC & DOC fees;  No sentence credit if revoked
CRT:  I will consider modification of the No Contact - if def is doing well & free from probation violations - you can write to this CRT for a review of the No contact
Domestic Abuse Hrg set for 6-23-15 @ 4 pm w/ CCMT
Motion for Consolidation w/ cases 14CF609, 15CM75, 15CM309 & 15CM329 - Order consolidating cases in Br 5 signed by CCMT
